clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Gastroesophageal Reflux and Aspiration on Airway Inflammation and Microbiome in Children With Chronic Cough
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Gastroesophageal Reflux and Aspiration on Airway Inflammation and Microbiome in Children With Chronic Cough

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Using an active cohort of children in whom Airway and gastrointestinal endoscopy will be performed, investigators will conduct a chart review to obtain relevant clinical data and the investigators will use an aliquot of airway sample obtained during the clinically indicated bronchoscopy for microbiome analysis. A case-control study design will be used to study whether subjects with CC with GER have a distinct lung microbiome and increased inflammation as compared with subjects with CC without GER and to determine whether the microbiome and degree of inflammation is related to the type of GER (acidic versus nonacidic).

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Reflux Finding Score (RFS) in CC/GER- group and CC/GER+ group
Comparison of bronchoscopic secretions scoring system (BSSS) in CC/GER- group and CC/GER+ group

arm_group.description: CC/GER+ presence of chronic cough and presence of GER evidenced by esophago-gastro-duodenoscopy (EGD) with biopsy and Esophageal Impedance Monitoring (EIM)
CC/GER- presence of chronic cough and absence of GER by esophago-gastro-duodenoscopy (EGD) with biopsy and Esophageal Impedance Monitoring (EIM)

biospec_descr.textblock: Case: CC/GER+ presence of chronic cough and presence of GER evidenced by esophago-gastro-duodenoscopy (EGD) with biopsy and Esophageal Impedance Monitoring (EIM) Control: CC/GER- presence of chronic cough and absence of GER by esophago-gastro-duodenoscopy (EGD) with biopsy and Esophageal Impedance Monitoring (EIM)

study_pop.textblock: Children (Age 0 - 24 years) referred to the NYU Pediatric AeroDigestive Center to evaluate for CC (>4weeks).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children (Age 0 - 24 years) referred to the NYU Pediatric AeroDigestive Center to evaluate for CC (>4weeks).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Antibiotic or steroids (inhaled or systemic) use within the prior one-week. Rationale: Antibacterial drugs and immune-modulators are confounders that may impact the microbiome and inflammation. While longer period free of Antibacterial drugs and immune-modulators would be desired, it would be unethical and it is not the usual standard of care to withdraw treatment for longer periods of time.
- Interstitial Lung Disease or pneumonia on X-ray
- Cystic fibrosis
- Primary ciliary dyskinesia
- Immunodeficiency syndromes
- Major airway abnormalities
- Proton pump inhibitor/H2-receptor antagonist therapy within the prior 2 weeks
